name: Mixed Bag 32 Quiz | Mixed 10 Q. Difficult [C] | 10 Questions

questions.text: What state's governors have included McKinley, F. Lausche and J. Rhodes?
questions.explanation:
Ohio.

	Ohio entered the union on March 1, 1803 as the 17th state. Columbus is the capital.

questions.text: The rembrandt is a late blooming variety of what flower?
questions.explanation:
Tulip.

	The tulip is in the lily family. Other late blooming varieties include the Darwin and parrot tulips.

questions.text: The first atomic bomb was exploded in which state?
questions.explanation:
New Mexico.

	At Alamogordo on July 16, 1945.

questions.text: What does the Russian word 'pravda' mean?
questions.explanation:
Truth.

	'Pravda' was also the Soviet Union's most well-known newspaper.

questions.text: What is the name of Brooke Shield's mother?
questions.explanation:
Teri.

	Brooke was born in 1965 in New York City. A model and an actress she started her career in Ivory Soap commercials at the age of eleven months.

questions.text: In what city is St. Marks Square?
questions.explanation:
Venice.

	The square was originally designed as the administrative center of Venice. It is flanked by St. Marks Cathederal among other buildings.

Fiat.

	Fiat is an acronym for Fabbrica Italiana De Automobili Di Torino. It is the leading Italian vehicle making company.

questions.text: In which state was Thomas Edison born?
questions.explanation:
Ohio.

	In Milan, Ohio 1847. He developed the electric light bulb, a sound recording devise and the motion picture projector among other things.

questions.text: Who hosted 'The Breakfast Club' on radio?
questions.explanation:
Don McNeill.

	It was first broadcast in June of 1933.It had such features as 'march around the breakfast table', 'moment of silent prayer' and 'memory time'.

Scarf.

	Along with being an outdoor covering for the neck it was also a long scarf worn by clergymen in the Anglican Church.
